Control panel
The
control panel
(toolbar) is located above the workspace and contains functional buttons that allow the user to operate with
System objects
.
Example of the control panel in the object type profile:
Example of the control panel in the object registry:
The set of control panel buttons depends on the System object displayed and is formed automatically. Additionally, the administrator can configure the display of additional buttons (for example, the printed form button for a specific object).
If the screen width does not accommodate the entire list of tools, some of them will be available after clicking the
button.
The
basic controls
are provided as follows:
Button
Purpose
Creating a new object. Creating an object is available in the following modes:
In this window – entering data for the new object in the current browser window;
In modal window – entering data for the new object in the modal window;
In a new tab – entering data for the new object in a new browser tab.
Editing the selected object. Working with the object is available in the following modes:
In this window – editing the object in the current window;
In modal window – editing the object in the modal window;
In a new tab – editing the object in a new browser tab.
Saving the changes made to the object profile / object type.
Copying the selected object. A copy of the selected object will be created, and its profile will be shown in the current browser window.
Deleting the selected object. Available deletion options:
Delete permanently;
Move to
Recycle Bin
.
Permanent object deletion and clearing the recycle bin are available to users with the
"Delete objects without possibility of recovery"
permission.
Forced update of data in the presented registry / object profile.
Data in the
registry
can be updated
automatically
.
The exception is the
edit mode
– when working in this mode, all changes made to the object are saved after clicking the
button.
When the "Save entered data when closing a new (unsaved) object"
setting
is active, the
button
in the object profile
can be used to
clear the pre-filled fields
.
Viewing changes to the selected object. Working with
change audit
is available in the following modes:
In this window – viewing data in the current window;
In modal window – viewing data in the modal window;
In a new tab – viewing data in the new tab.
Viewing the object’s relations and dependencies. Find more in
"Dependent objects"
.
This button is available if the user has "Read" access for the "Dependent objects" [SYS_DEPENDENT_OBJECTS]
action
.
Viewing the object’s
tags
panel.
This button is available if the user has the following permissions:
"Read" for the "Tag management" [SYS_TAG_MANAGEMENT]
action
;
"Run" for
"View tags"
[VIEW_TAGS].
Viewing the full list of available types in the
"Object type"
registry.
The visibility of the button is controlled by the "Run" permission for
"View system types in the "Object type" registry"
.
In addition to this permission, the following access permissions may also be required:
"Read" permission for "Show all types" [SHOW_ALL_TYPES]
action
– to display the button in the "Object type" registry;
"Run" permissions for
"View metadata"
and/or
"Edit metadata"
– to work with the "Object type" registry.
The button is available in the "Object type" registry, as well as in other parts of the System interface where the functionality to select a type from the full list is implemented.
Find the list and purpose of the registry control panel elements in
"Working with the Object Registry"
.
